Eating and digesting bone is totally normal for predators, including domestic dogs and cats. Raw bones of appropriate sizes are perfectly digestible for pretty much all predators. They don't perfectly pick skeletons clean like they do in cartoons, they eat all or most of smaller carcasses. I assume this just means that the hyenas could eat larger, weight-bearing bones?

The idea that bears drove hyenas into extinction is illogical.  A hyena is about the same size and strength as a North American wolf.  Hyenas are pack animals as are wolves, which is why wolves have not been driven into extinction by bears.  If logic follows that the hyena and the wolf are essentially interchangeable as far as the ecosystem would be concerned, then bears could not have driven them into extinction, since the wolf would also have been driven into extinction with them.  Further reason why bears would not drive smaller predatory animals like wolves/hyenas out of existence is because bears hibernate during the winter when food is scarce.  This places animals like wolves and hyenas at the top of the food chain for at least 6 months out of the year.  It is far more likely that the wolves drove hyenas into extinction.  Personally I believe that God created all things and the reason why you have animals that live nearer the equator being found under a mountain of ice is because there was a huge cataclysmic event, called the flood, and apparently as part of the fun, there were parts of the earth where the water became ice very rapidly, entrapping the animals that were alive in the area.  After the flood waters receded, the geographic areas where ice formed remained ice.  The earth's climate changed because of the cataclysm.

Beringia is not a land bridge.  It's just land.  There's no such thing as a land bridge.

Other competition that could have drove the arctic hyenas out could also have been larger members of the weasel family, like the wolverine, who eat everything of an animal they kill except for larger teeth and horns. They still try with those. Wolverines also can find corpses frozen in deep snow to scavenge off of them as well.

One last terrifying thing about them; you know how there are sheep in North America that can climb nearly vertical cliffs to escape predators? They are easily out climbed, killed, and then eaten.
